2728155d-e2c5-46c5-983c-2918764e8b84.description: The University of Louisville Franchise Management Certificate Bootcamp empowered earners to embrace their full entrepreneurial potential. Designed with both the franchisee and franchisor in mind, the Franchise Management Certificate Bootcamp has the rigor and reputation you expect from a nationally ranked, AACSB-accredited college. The earner has enriched their skillset through courses in franchise law, human resources management, finance, and strategic planning.
2728155d-e2c5-46c5-983c-2918764e8b84.name: Franchise Management Bootcamp Certificate

alignments.name: The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB)
alignments.description: Earn 250 credits toward the Certified Franchise Executive (CFE) designation from the International Franchise Association (IFA) with each completed course, for a total of 1500 credits.

badge_template_activities.title: Each course is self-paced, with about 12-15 hours of work that you can complete at any time during the week, including blog entries, quizzes, and interaction with other professionals.
Non-credit program. No bachelor's degree required

skills.name: Building a Profitable Relationship with your Franchisor

14847a98-1f1b-434c-af28-71cad6d3293d.description: Earners of the UofL Health Academy for Inclusive Excellence badge have demonstrated awareness and knowledge of diversity, equity, and inclusion competencies. Earners explored how to achieve equitable outcomes for minoritized patient groups and employees. Their curriculum focused on leadership, employee development, and planning and implementation of DEI best practices in a healthcare environment.
14847a98-1f1b-434c-af28-71cad6d3293d.name: UofL Health Academy for Inclusive Excellence Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must be employed at UofL Health.
Earner must have completed all eight (2.5 hour) Academy of Inclusive Excellence sessions
Earner must complete each session’s pre- and post-work
Earner must complete a DEI project plan for implementation at UofL Health.

f7301e50-1abb-4545-b1a8-b2e4948235fe.description: The earner has demonstrated critical data management and data science expertise needed to make strategic business decisions in a fast-changing marketplace. They have gained knowledge and skills in a developing and in-demand field including business analytics, artificial intelligence, blockchain, spreadsheet modeling, and storytelling through data. All of these modules were completed with a business management focus. Earners can effectively interpret business data & manage the future of business.
f7301e50-1abb-4545-b1a8-b2e4948235fe.name: Managerial Analytics

alignments.name: The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 12 credit hours (seven graduate-level classes) at the University of Louisville. Courses in statistics, data analytics, decision-making, artificial intelligence, blockchain, and more.
Courses taken towards the completion of this certificate can be applied to the University of Louisville's Online Master of Business Administration program.
Eligibility: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, Minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.5 to be admitted in good standing. Note: GMAT/GRE scores are not required for admission.
Tuition and Financial Aid Opportunities: The University of Louisville offers need- and merit-based scholarships to help online students meet the cost of their education.

c4d72af6-0b7e-4c8c-9124-b6b24c6a1492.description: Individuals who have earned the Cybersecurity Workforce Explorer Level badge have been able to demonstrate the ability to understand and apply fundamental knowledge to multiple IT disciplines that support and promote cybersecurity in organizations. a422fee8-1e2b-4fdc-a4c5-af2cfb2cc9c1.description: Earners have gained critical insights and practical knowledge around the fundamentals and core skills of franchise management. Individuals have demonstrated franchising knowledge through courses in franchise law, human resources management, finance, and strategic planning. a422fee8-1e2b-4fdc-a4c5-af2cfb2cc9c1.name: Franchise Management

0d6b6626-6a25-4bdd-834b-7ef8ec596ed5.description: The earner is able to apply entrepreneurship techniques in business development and has learned how to build out and design a website in WIX website, the role of Google Analytics, automation, and CRM tools. Earners analyze future implications of artificial intelligence, IoTs, automation, algorithms, and more on job markets and daily lives in a professional manner.

badge_template_activities.title: This training series prepares students to analyze the role of entrepreneur leadership through the lens of business applications in website development, AI, automation, and Google Analytics.

174d2d70-8412-4340-bd1d-7893ed3a4c69.description: The Ethics Certificate has prepared earners for ethical leadership in workforce industries. The individual has earned this credential which indicates their preparation for ethics compliance and other modes of demonstrating ethical practice in multiple professions.
174d2d70-8412-4340-bd1d-7893ed3a4c69.name: Ethics Certificate

Students are required to maintain at least a 3.0 GPA in the certificate, with no more than one grade of C in classes counted towards the certificate.
Eligibility: Undergraduate status, who are currently enrolled at the University of Louisville. Students must be in good standing to be enrolled in the certificate program.

05cb47b7-0deb-4310-b38a-2ed5ff11f0f4.description: Individual earners of the Cardinal Principles Micro-Credential have demonstrated the ability to understand and apply foundational knowledge on how to cultivate a community of care, accountability, respect, diversity, inclusion, the ability to be transparent, designing a noble purpose, agility, and leadership. alignments.description: The University of Louisville's Cardinal Principles prepare individuals for the workforce with copious hard and soft skills, specifically around the ability to cultivate efficient and productive cultures, the ability to be agile, leadership skills, and technology development.

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will build out a website using Adobe software to document competencies mastered and skills earned.

65fd58f7-fd22-4a54-9f08-d36d15480116.description: Earners have developed their overall knowledge and skills essential for success in the business of horse racing from a university located in the heart of the world’s most famous horse race, the Kentucky Derby. Meet Our Leadership Team

ca066559-3784-4551-a730-6d3e7649375e.description: The earner has completed 5 modules, in 40 hours of a cybersecurity course. Modules included beginner lessons on legal issues in cybersecurity, infrastructure technology, network and information security, and computer forensics. Individuals have been given 5 separate asynchronous lectures and assessments that have been completed for each module.
ca066559-3784-4551-a730-6d3e7649375e.name: Cybersecurity Basics for Law Enforcement

badge_template_activities.title: This badge can be earned by Law Enforcement Officers and their support staff by completing a 40-hour, online course. The course includes lessons on legal issues surrounding cybersecurity in law enforcement and introductions to infrastructure technology, network security, information security, and computer forensics.

07c9352c-bd24-4841-a33a-89df1777f97c.description: The cybersecurity program focuses on enhancing the student's foundational knowledge. The modules completed consist of artificial intelligence, robotics process analysis, cognitive computing, and coding within the allotted three-month timeline.
07c9352c-bd24-4841-a33a-89df1777f97c.name: Cybersecurity A.I. Bundle

badge_template_activities.title: The modules for this course consist of artificial intelligence, robotics process analysis, cognitive computing, and coding within the allotted three-month timeline.

bcc6828e-130e-4a66-85dc-85530ac35b9c.description: This program is designed for College of Business undergraduate students. Students have been involved in co-curricular experiences outside of class that contribute to the three pillars of success: academic, personal, and professional. In these pillars, students completed a set number of activities that helped them to build skills and credentials that employers want to see. Earners of this badge will have demonstrated the ability to understand and apply NACE-inspired career readiness competencies.
bcc6828e-130e-4a66-85dc-85530ac35b9c.name: Cardinal Flight

badge_template_activities.title: After joining the Cardinal Flight, students can earn rewards by participating in events and receiving recognition throughout the program. At the end of each semester, we will recognize students for their experiences beyond the classroom. Student recognition may include spotlight features on social media and the College of Business website, surprise giveaways, gifts, and invitations to special events.

The National Association of Colleges and Employers (NACE) defines career readiness through career competencies identified by employers as essential skills or competencies they seek in job candidates entering the workforce.

The University and the College of Business are committed to providing support services to all of our students, in order to ensure their educational experience is fruitful. Nurturing a career means wholistic support and we offer assistance to students with their academic studies and beyond.

Founded in October 2018, the Project on Positive Leadership is an interdisciplinary unit, housed in the University of Louisville’s College of Business, dedicated to increasing positive leadership in the world. We fulfill this mission by creating and disseminating teaching tools for positive leadership, supporting research within the field, and collaborating with other units within our university and other organizations throughout the region and beyond who embrace similar missions.
